newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-BAYERN STAY TOP AFTER IMPRESSIVE 5-2 WIN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BAYERN STAY TOP AFTER IMPRESSIVE 5-2 WIN.

text.p: Bayern Munich kept their three-point lead at the top of the German first division after a 5-2 thrashing of unglamorous Duisburg on Saturday.

The Bavarians could even afford the luxury of missing a second-half penalty after first-half goals from Juergen Klinsmann and Mario Basler, two second-half strikes from Christian Ziege and an own goal from the visitors.

Defender Alfred Nijhuis scored two late consolation goals for promoted Duisburg, who have spent more time in the regional leagues and second division in the last decade than in the Bundesliga. They were simply outplayed in Munich's Olympic stadium.
Champions Borussia Dortmund were also in goalscoring mood in a 4-1 home victory over middle-of-the-table 1860 Munich and stayed second.
But Bayer Leverkusen, who started the day level on points with Dortmund, lost ground in the race when they could only manage a goalless draw at lowly Fortuna Duesseldorf.
Bayer are now five points behind Bayern, who travel to Leverkusen for a fascinating clash next weekend.
